Convert wet weight to approximate energy content

Source: R/wet2j.R
wet2j.Rd

This performs a simple conversion of wet weight to energy via Peters' approximate conversion.

Usage

wet2j(wet)

Arguments

wet

A vector of wet masses (in kg)

Value

The equivalent energy in Joules

References

Peters, R.H. (1983) The Ecological Implications of Body Size. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press (Cambridge Studies in Ecology), pp. 231–296. https://doi.org/10.1017/CBO9780511608551, Appendix Ia

Author

Francis Windram

Examples

v <- rnorm(20, 10, 2)
v
#>  [1] 12.148692  8.669824 12.227905  9.508207  7.644873  8.048299 12.130115
#>  [8] 10.263341 10.977258  6.601099  7.058527 10.568301 12.674641 10.473393
#> [15] 12.636587 11.047820 11.213496  9.780129 10.344363  9.819345
wet2j(v)
#>  [1] 85040842 60688765 85595334 66557450 53514114 56338091 84910802 71843389
#>  [9] 76840803 46207692 49409692 73978105 88722486 73313748 88456107 77334737
#> [17] 78494473 68460901 72410544 68735418
